intro: Aplectrum, commonly known as the yellow false unicorn, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hollow stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Aplectrum is often found in moist, wooded areas and is valued for its historical use in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
